DataElement.preferredName: Patient Alcohol Consumption Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test Total Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The calculated value or added sum resulting from semi-quantitative responses from 10 questions on the validated instrument named the Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test (AUDIT, either self or interviewer administered) to assess potential risks, including substance dependence, from behavior of an individual related to consumption of liquids containing ethanol or other alcohols.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Alcohol Consumption Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The validated instrument named the Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test (AUDIT, whether self or interviewer administered) that contains 10 questions with semi-quantitative responses that are used to assess potential risks, including substance dependence, from behavior of an individual related to consumption of liquids containing ethanol or other alcohols.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:consumption of liquids containing ethanol; includes the behavior of drinking the alcohol.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
Consumption of liquids containing ethanol, including the behaviors associated with drinking the alcohol.

Property.preferredName: Alcohol Use Disease or Disorder Identification Test
Property.preferredDefinition: A volatile liquid prepared by fermentation of certain carbohydrates. Alcohol acts as a central nervous system (CNS) depressant, a diuretic, and a disinfectant. Although the exact mechanism of CNS depression is unknown, alcohol may act by inhibiting the opening of calcium channels, mediated by the binding of the inhibitory neurotransmitter gamma-amino butyric acid (GABA) to GABA-A receptors, or through inhibitory actions at N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA)-type glutamate receptors. Alcohol inhibits the production of antidiuretic hormone, thereby producing diuresis that may lead to dehydration. This agent kills organisms by denaturing their proteins.:put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:The procedure of having an identity established.:A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: A volatile liquid prepared by fermentation of certain carbohydrates. Alcohol acts as a central nervous system (CNS) depressant, a diuretic, and a disinfectant. Although the exact mechanism of CNS depression is unknown, alcohol may act by inhibiting the opening of calcium channels, mediated by the binding of the inhibitory neurotransmitter gamma-amino butyric acid (GABA) to GABA-A receptors, or through inhibitory actions at N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA)-type glutamate receptors. Alcohol inhibits the production of antidiuretic hormone, thereby producing diuresis that may lead to dehydration. This agent kills organisms by denaturing their proteins.
put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
The procedure of having an identity established.
A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test Total Score
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The calculated value or added sum resulting from semi-quantitative values for all questions answered on the Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test (AUDIT) in order to assess potential risks, including substance dependence, from behavior of an individual related to consumption of liquids containing ethanol or other alcohols.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Alcohol Use Disease or Disorder Identification Test Total Score

Although the exact mechanism of CNS depression is unknown, alcohol may act by inhibiting the opening of calcium channels, mediated by the binding of the inhibitory neurotransmitter gamma-amino butyric acid (GABA) to GABA-A receptors, or through inhibitory actions at N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA)-type glutamate receptors. Alcohol inhibits the production of antidiuretic hormone, thereby producing diuresis that may lead to dehydration. Concepts.definition: A volatile liquid prepared by fermentation of certain carbohydrates. Alcohol acts as a central nervous system (CNS) depressant, a diuretic, and a disinfectant. Although the exact mechanism of CNS depression is unknown, alcohol may act by inhibiting the opening of calcium channels, mediated by the binding of the inhibitory neurotransmitter gamma-amino butyric acid (GABA) to GABA-A receptors, or through inhibitory actions at N-methyl-D-aspartate (NMDA)-type glutamate receptors. Alcohol inhibits the production of antidiuretic hormone, thereby producing diuresis that may lead to dehydration. This agent kills organisms by denaturing their proteins.
put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
The procedure of having an identity established.
A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.
Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
